title: Implementation Summary: Dynamic Database Updates
text: Added update_annotations_table() function : - Reads to_be_voted_images_file - Queries database existing entries - Creates unique keys (coordinates|REF|ALT) comparison - Identifies adds new entries - Processes paths way initial population - Returns count new entries added Key Features: - Duplicate prevention using composite key (coordinates + REF + ALT) - Handles multiple mutations coordinates different alleles - Error handling missing files - Consistent path processing initial database population

title: Implementation Summary: Dynamic Database Updates
text: Added “Update Database” button : - Appears admin panel alongside admin functions - accessible admin users - Triggers database update clicked - Shows modal dialog results (success, updates, error) Implementation Details:
code: # In mod_admin.R - Button click handler shiny::observeEvent(input$update_database_btn, {   shiny::req(login_trigger()$admin == 1)      conn <- pool::poolCheckout(db_pool)   on.exit(pool::poolReturn(conn))      new_entries_count <- update_annotations_table(     conn,     cfg$to_be_voted_images_file   )      # Show modal dialog with results })

title: ShinyImgVoteR
text: Purpose: Collaborative image review voting Delivered form ? Shiny web application R package Application Purpose: Display set images one time users. Capture structured votes (agree/disagree) standardized options. Key Features: Users can grouped need login access application. Hotkeys allow quick voting via keyboard shortcuts. Possibility go back previous images change votes. votes users stored TSV easy downstream analysis. leaderboard displays user’s groups voting progress real-time. Users can learn voting behavior (time till vote casted, images voted per session etc.) via personal statistics.

title: ShinyImgVoteR
text: application enables users vote set images features tracking user behavior (e.g. average time casting vote), handling vote changes allowing users update previous votes, supporting keyboard shortcuts efficient voting. Users get presented randomly picked image, instance IGV (Integrative Genomics Viewer) screenshot displaying genetic mutation, can express opinion shown mutation using predefined categories, confirming rejecting validity, proposing different mutation location. “True Positive”, “False Positive”, “Uncertain”. Votes stored TSV file per user, SQLite database maintains aggregated vote counts mutation. FLOW: User logs → triggers mutation loading Mutation image data displayed User makes voting choices → stored TSV file Database updated vote counts Next mutation loaded automatically Process repeats mutations voted
